intro: Thesium transvaalense, commonly known as the Transvaal thesium, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, often spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually reduced to scales, and it produces yellowish or orange flowers during the warmer months. Thesium transvaalense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
